Hi All,
this is a first message to the group so I am hoping I havent been b=
eaten by technology.
having seen Carys beautifully mounted Kongo-bei katana=
 I was wondering what the current view/ opinion of this school was. I under=
stand that they were not particularly highly thought of 20+ years ago as th=
ey were regarded as ultra conservative and not conforming directly with one=
 of the 5 traditions. More recently 1 was listed in Comptons 100 masterpiec=
es and I have seen several others (well at least 1) with Juyo certification=
. I bought a O-suriage katana with hozon papers a couple of years ago and h=
ave to say I really like it, not least for the fact it is extremely healthy=
 ( particularly for a blade that is between 5 and 700 years old) and a powe=
rful blade. Originally it must have been 31+ inches long. Has the school be=
come more widely appreciated in recent years or is it just us ultra conserv=
ative suguha fanatics that love them.
would value opinions
regards
paul
